items.title: Like writing about growth marketing, product, or startup related topics?
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Like writing about growth marketing, product, or startup related topics?

Company: GrowthMentor
Location: Remote
Job Type: Freelance
Description

GrowthMentor (https://www.growthmentor.com) is looking for experienced bloggers to write engaging content on top of funnel topics surrounding startup life, growth marketing, and tools.

Potential topics may include:

  • Top # mistakes marketers make in <insert here PPC, content marketing, Social, etc.>
  • Top # <insert here genre of marketing tool> and how  <insert here persona> use them to do <insert here business benefit>
  • # Best Marketing Podcasts 2020 [categorized by type of marketing e.g. social media, content, paid acquisition, etc.]
CONTENT TOPICS WE’RE LOOKING FOR
  • Reviews of tools, services
  • Comparison posts, roundups
  • Articles will generally be top of funnel
THE STYLE AND TONE WE’RE LOOKING FOR
  • Conversational tone
  • Concise easy to read with proper formatting
WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR
  • Someone with a passion for growth, marketing, and business
  • Someone who can tell a great story
  • Someone with experience using popular marketing and project management tools.
  • Someone who is excited about what our brand stands for.
RATES

If your application is shortlisted, you'll be asked to start with a single (paid) article at $.05 per word so we can see if we're a good fit.

If we're a good fit, we'll revisit the rate after the first article and increase work scope (up to 4-8 posts a month).

After first article, expect to be able to earn in the range of $.10-.20/word depending on your experience and skill set.

Higher rates go to the applicants that don't require us to create detailed outlines for them and that deliver content that doesn't require heavy editing.

HOW TO APPLY

Fill in Typeform to Apply

Application Instructions
Fill in the Typeform to apply.

items.title: Medicare Agent - work from home opportunity, qualified, inbound leads
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Join the revolutionary ASSURANCE platform and uncap your earnings on the industry’s best work from home Medicare sales platform, selling Medicare Advantage, Supplement, and Prescription Drug plans to inbound, in-market shoppers.

 

We have just opened up 500 spots nationally for experienced Medicare agents to join our platform by May 29th.Spots are filling up fast! COVID-19 is changing the way all Medicare is sold, but Assurance was built from the ground up as a next-generation solution for times like these.

 

Join the ASSURANCE platform, and take advantage of:

  • 100% remote;, you log in when you’re ready to sell.
  • Assurance pays both commissions and production bonuses. There are no caps on how much you can make, and top ASSURANCE agents earn over $200,000 in compensation annually.
  • Free calls via inbound shoppers generated from ASSURANCE-owned and operated websites, television commercials, and direct mail. Our Guides prospect calls and transfer interested and qualified prospect to you.
  • Access to our proprietary billion-dollar software platform at no cost to you. The platform has all the tools to empower you to succeed!
  • Contract with leading national carriers such as Humana, Aetna, UnitedHealthcare, and more.


You are in total control as you work remotely from the comfort of your home or office. Calls are always flowing on the ASSURANCE platform; when you log in you are put in front of interested consumers ready to talk to you. You’re not spending time prospecting and appointment setting, buying your own leads to dial, or sitting in a call center for 8 hours per day waiting for the phone to ring. You are your ownboss and you’re surrounded online by other top performers just like you.


The Assurance system has eliminated industry inefficiencies and will provide you with free training & scripting, back office accounting & customer service, tech support, recommendation and quoting engines, and custom analytics on your performance. Now you see why we were called “the Uber of insurance” when we were acquired by Prudential Financial (NYSE: PRU) for $3.5B in 2019.

Requirements to access ASSURANCE Medicare platform as 1 of 500 elite producers:

  • AHIP certification
  • 3+ insurance state licenses
  • High-speed Internet, reliable computer, and headset with microphone
  • History of compliant insurance sales practice

Loopcv Team

items.title: MotorsportReg.com / Hagerty: Lead/Solo Product Designer for Automotive/Motorsport Events SaaS
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=45}
items.content:
Lead/Solo Product Designer for Automotive/Motorsport Events SaaS

About the Role 

As the lead and only designer on our SaaS product team, you are responsible for all UI/UX. There are no design managers, researchers or co-designers to fall back on - you must have the skills and seniority to personally ideate, shape, validate and polish the experience for our users. 

We need you to lead a world-class redesign where nothing is off-limits. The ideal candidate is highly inquisitive and outcome-oriented, validating intuition derived from experience with quantitative and qualitative input from users, contextual research and analytics. 

Balancing visual design, information architecture and interaction design, you will collaborate closely with developers to rapidly get value into the hands of users. We want you to establish and maintain a design system that allows developers to independently implement common screens and flows while you focus your deep thinking on the new, unusual, and reimagined.

About Us

MotorsportReg.com is the best place to organize, find and attend automotive and motorsport events. We are like Eventbrite for anything requiring an engine: racing, track days, autocross, karting, drifting, cars and coffee, motorcycles, karting, meetups and rally. 

Part of Hagerty, an automotive lifestyle brand for people who love cars, we are a fully-remote SaaS team supporting 1,300 clubs, racetracks and sanctioning bodies with our CRM, event management platform and marketplace. With 7,000 events managed annually by our customers, our goal is to be the number one marketplace for motorized events - making it easier to organize and attend events. 


Responsibilities 
  • Collaborate with the Product Manager to conceive and design new features and services from scratch as well as improve existing systems
  • Use a complete range of fidelity to support decision-making including sketches, user flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes
  • Analyze user feedback and activity and, partnering with the Product Manager, determine how to iterate to enhance the user experience
  • Independently conduct concept and “hallway usability” tests to gather rapid feedback and partner with the Hagerty UX testing team for more formal research
  • Create and maintain guidance and patterns which developers can independently use to implement common screens and flows while you focus on new features and unusual use cases
  • Nail the big picture flows, architecture and navigation as well as the micro-interactions of animations, loading states and transitions
  • Everyone on our team talks to users and attends motorsport events – this keeps us close to our customers and our empathy high

Requirements
  • Strong portfolio of product design, interaction design and visual design for mobile/web applications 
  • Experience with complex applications where you've made tasks feel easy and approachable
  • Have great writing skills to effectively communicate with the team and customers (as a remote team, we live on Slack so you will write a lot)
  • Familiarity with HTML/CSS - no need to be a front-end developer but you should be comfortable translating photoshop/sketch/etc into HTML/CSS
  • Experience working with developers deploying frequently and having the discretion to judge what is good enough to ship and iterate rather than wait for a perfect release
  • Previous role in a distributed environment such as a remote worker, freelancer or self-employed is (almost) mandatory

Bonuses 
  • More front-end skills including familiarity with ReactJS / VueJS / Javascript would make our heart flutter
  • Experience with modern development practices that include Git, Docker, AWS, continuous integration and deployment
  • User research and testing experience such as UserTesting.com, designing A/B tests, analyzing MixPanel data, usability audits, picking up the phone or observing a user in the field

What You Can Expect 

As a remote team, we stay connected with Slack and Zoom. Our software lifecycle revolves around Git, Docker, AWS and Node/VueJS. Design has been a mix of Sketch and InvisionApp (but we're not tied to them if you have other faves). We have daily huddles to keep things moving and you'll have weekly 1:1s with your manager to discuss your needs and goals. 

We have deadlines like everyone else, but because we value work-life integration, we do not expect routine long hours. A well-rested and well-rounded top performer with ruthless focus will deliver substantially more in 40-45 hours than a team of burnouts sitting in front of a screen 60 hours a week. 

Whether you're a motorsport fanatic or have never set foot at a racetrack, you'll find our team and our customers to be a fun group of passionate enthusiasts. 


What We're Offering 
  • Competitive market-rate salary dependent on experience 
  • Work from anywhere in United States
  • The team gathers twice a year for fantastic in-person retreats
  • Occasional on-site visits to motorsport events with potential or current customers
  • Medical, vision, and dental coverage for you and your dependents including Telemed service on your phone
  • 3 weeks paid time off annually, rolls over and accrues up to 12 weeks
  • 401K with up to 4% instant matching 
  • Maternity leave of 12 weeks + spouses eligible for 2 weeks. Also adoption assistance up to $5,000.
  • Hagerty Drivers Club with roadside assistance for your cars
  • Hobby related benefits including Automotive Enthusiast Certificate, Auto Restoration Scholarships, Hagerty Driving Experience, Collector Loan Discount program and Hagerty Driving Academy
  • Also: Employee Assistance Program, Tuition Reimbursement, Student Loan assistance, Car Seat program for new parents
  • MotorsportReg is part of Hagerty, a company with a strong culture infused with automotive passion and a certified Great Place To Work

Ready to take the Green Flag? 

We hope you’re the one!  Let us know why you want to work with us by filling out our application including a link to your portfolio.

If your portfolio has a password, please be sure to include it.

items.title: Harvest: Senior Product Manager (Native Apps)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=12, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=4, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Product Manager (Native Apps)

As a Senior Product Manager, Native Apps, you are responsible for all instances of owned and operated Harvest apps beyond the web. This includes our iOS, Android, Windows, and Mac app suite. You and your engineering, design, and support partners will lay out a clear vision for Harvest Native Apps, its relation to the core web product, and deliver said vision. You’ll own the product suite end-to-end, starting from research all the way through to app store optimization and relationship management with hardware and OS manufacturers. You will have a broad latitude to do what it takes to make Harvest Native Apps a product offering that’s on par with the web counterpart, while leveraging the unique use-cases and benefits that native ecosystems offer. You’ll report to our Head of Product and Customer Experience.


What You'll Do:


  • Own the product roadmap, backlog, and OKRs of Harvest native apps product suite, with an eye towards compatibility with the web product suite.
  • Run projects from end-to-end with design and development teams. We operate using Basecamp’s Shape Up cycle development framework (not agile).
  • Set a vision for excellence for your domain space and actualize them.
  • Build and evangelize a “native apps too” culture by cultivating and championing the work of the team within and outside of Harvest.
  • Operate day-to-day aspects of the app stores for Harvest so the product is well represented, have great discovery and download funnel. Liaise support and monitoring workflows with appropriate internal teams.
  • Build and maintain relationships with key technology partners in this space.
  • Occasionally create mock-ups, UI elements, and work with developers in light-touch design needs.
  • Communicate progress and updates succinctly with the executive team and the company at large.
  • Collaborate with other product, marketing, and customer support teammates on various initiatives.

Who you are:


  • You have a track record of owning a product suite with exposure to more than one million customers.
  • You have expert understanding of native apps development cycle and ecosystem.
  • To you, WWDC and Google I/O are must-watch live streams or must-attend events. You care deeply about the usability and design of connected devices of all kinds. In your spare time, you contemplate how technology affects people in the always-connected lifestyle.
  • You embrace a challenge, persist in the face of setbacks, understand give-take priorities, champion open disagree-and-commit dialogs, and are inspired by the success of others.
  • You are technically savvy. While you don’t have to write any code yourself, you’re not shy about jumping into GitHub and working with engineers on various issues or juggling a hardware library.
  • You have a track record for solving problems with real business impact and have owned the setting, building, and validating impact hypotheses. You are outcome-focused.
  • You are self-directed, curious, and patient. You enjoy working independently without much supervision.
  • You have exposure to and enjoy business development work, especially with regards to building relationships with technology partners in the native app space.
  • You like small teams. You want to get to know people by name, and you’re not shy about starting something from scratch.
  • You value a distributed and diverse work culture. Working side-by-side with co-workers from around the world is something you cherish.
  • You value design excellence and craftsmanship over growth-for-growth's-sake.
What You’ve Done:


  • Ideally 8+ years experience in Product Management, preferably with a focus in native apps space.
  • Strong analytical and strategic thinking and the ability to use data and research to inform decisions and inspire new avenues for exploration.
  • Expertise in project management.
  • Strong interest and track-record in dabbling with design and UX.
  • Expert understanding of native apps ecosystem capabilities.
  • Experience in leading a globally distributed team, formally or informally.

This position requires a four-hour overlap with 8am - 5pm ET.

items.title: Harvest: Senior Product Manager (Integrations)
items.content:
Senior Product Manager (Integrations)

As a Senior Product Manager, Integration, you are responsible for managing Harvest integrations within the environment of our partners’ domain and vice versa. Harvest believes that our product is most useful when it is compatible with our customers’ many workflows. You may be working with partners in the productivity space, creative tools, as well as finance, HR, and back office. You’ll own the relationship with various partners, manage expectations, coordinate marketing efforts, set and achieve outcomes for the work within your domain. You’ll have broad latitude to help shape product partnership strategy, developer community strategy, and API related work. You’ll work closely with our cross-functional team and partners to create meaningful impact for our customers. You’ll report to our Head of Product and Customer Experience.

What You'll Do:
  • Own Integration roadmap, backlog, and OKRs, including but not limited to a thoughtful matrix of partnership opportunity across all of Harvest’s product offerings.
  • Oversee all Integration projects end to end with the partners’ team as well as internal design + development team.
  • Set a vision for excellence for your domain space, be able to back that vision up with solid research and analyses, and actualize them.
  • Evangelize/be the voice of partners platform on behalf of Harvest in the public domain.
  • Occasionally create mock-ups, UI elements, or audit design work as needed.
  • Communicate progress and updates succinctly with the executive team and the company at large.
Who You Are:
  • You live and breathe the technology landscape. Perhaps you are an active member of Product Hunt or an avid follower of tech news from start-up to enterprise.
  • You are technically savvy. While you don’t have to write any code yourself, you understand APIs, oAuth, and front-end tech stack very well. Bonus point if you can do light-lifting UX as well.
  • You have some exposure to business development work, formally or informally.
  • You are organized. You manage your time well and can rally teams to work under occasional tight deadlines.
  • You have a knack for public speaking, and either have spoken at conferences or are comfortable representing Harvest at tech conferences.
  • You are okay with minimal work travels (~10%).
  • You like small teams. You want to get to know people by name, and you’re not shy about starting something from scratch.
  • You value a distributed and diverse work culture. Working side-by-side with co-workers from around the world is something you cherish.
  • You value design excellence and craftsmanship over growth-for-growth's-sake.
  • You embrace a challenge, persist in the face of setbacks, understand give-take priorities, champion open disagree-and-commit dialogs, and are inspired by the success of others.
  • You are self-directed, curious, and patient. You enjoy working independently without much supervision.
What You’ve Done:
  • 8+ years experience in Product Management, preferably with a focus on product partnership, integration, or developer community tracks.
  • Strong analytical and strategic thinking. Able to use data and research to inform decisions and inspire new avenues for exploration.
  • Expertise in project management.
  • Strong interest in dabbling with design and UX.
  • Able to represent Harvest well in external meetings and at conferences.
  • Have experience working with a distributed team, whether it is yours or client/partners.
This position requires a four-hour overlap with 8am - 5pm ET.

items.title: Product Marketing Manager
items.content:
Remote

Celigo is looking for a Product Marketing Manager to develop and execute the go-to-market strategy around Celigo’s CloudExtend product portfolio. The PMM will report to the General Manager of CloudExtend and work closely with product and sales to drive the segmentation analysis, positioning, messaging, and the content needed to succeed.

Highly qualified candidates will be considered for remote work within the U.S.

What would you do, if hired?

  • Understand customer pain and how our products solve their problems
  • Evangelize CloudExtend products and services, through external speaking engagements which could include: conferences, webcasts, trade shows, and meetups, authoring thought leadership pieces
  • Create positioning, personas, and messaging to support sales and marketing campaigns with global sales teams
  • Work side by side with our Product Manager to discover opportunities for new products
  • Work with the product and sales team to develop repeatable sales motions to increase volume, deal size, and upsell opportunities
  • Create and update web content as new features and functionality are added
  • Create data sheets, case studies, battle cards, blogs, white papers and any other collateral as needed with a strong emphasis on the technical aspects of the products/solutions and specific use cases
  • Engage with key customers to create customer testimonials (written and video) and case studies
  • Create and leverage Demand Generation content to support the execution of an integrated marketing program to drive demand for CloudExtend products
  • Deliver use cases and playbooks and enable sales with assets, presentations and sales tools, as needed
  • Provide technical competitive analysis to the sales teams – be the market expert
  • Conduct research and develop an overall industry/solution business and marketing plan, including specific measures of success
  • Experience identifying and collaborating with key technology partners to develop joint solutions and marketing programs
  • Manage and cultivate relationships with leading industry bloggers and analysts (Gartner, Forrester, Ovum, Diginomica, etc)

Who are we looking for:

  • Self-starter with excellent writing skills and the ability to talk to both a business and technical use
  • Someone who can develop clear, compelling industry and functional value propositions, based on pain points that resonate with customers and prospect
  • A minimum of 3 years of experience in product marketing in the SaaS and enterprise software market
  • Cloud Computing experience (Salesforce, NetSuite, Workday, Intercom, Outreach, etc) highly desirable
  • Demonstrated ability to develop a wide range of marketing materials and sales tools for lead generation and sales enablement
  • Experience working in and/or marketing to target industries (Retail, Manufacturing, High Tech, Media & Advertising) and business functions (IT, Finance, Operations)
  • Proven ability to provide the overall marketing direction for a solution, or set of solutions, in an industry or functional area, including building a market-driven business case, developing a marketing and launch plan, creating compelling messaging based on customer pain points, and working closely with customers, industry experts, press and analysts

Why you’ll love it here:

  • We are solving a really hard problem that affects almost every business on the planet: integrating cloud app
  • You get the best of both worlds: a start-up opportunity at a company that has already established itself in the market with thousands of happy customers
  • You’ll have the opportunity to make a significant contribution to the company as well as the iPaaS industry as a whole
  • We’re at an exciting crossroads as we re-imagine the Integration and iPaaS space. This will take teamwork, creativity, strategic thinking and a willingness to advance the market
  • We offer a strong benefits package, 401k, pre-tax commuter expense reimbursement, fully stocked kitchen, snacks, and many other perks.
Apply for job

items.title: Chief Product Officer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote
  • Level: Senior
  • Position Type: Full Time
  • Education Level: 4 Year Degree
  • Job Category: Executive

Mission:

  • At Nearpod we empower educators to create learning experiences that engage and inspire millions of students around the world.
  • Through a combination of digital lessons, interactive features (see our Virtual Field Trips and 3D objects initiatives), videos (including our Flocabulary hip-hop video platform), and real-time assessments Nearpod has become a leader – and teacher favorite – in teaching and learning.

Location: Remote

Position Overview:

  • As Nearpod’s Chief Product Officer, you will be responsible for setting direction and driving strategic initiatives empowering teachers to have an impact in their classrooms.
  • You will work closely with senior leadership across the organization to define product strategy and build and communicate the product roadmap.
  • You will be responsible for managing, mentoring, and growing our Product, UX, and Content teams into their next phase of success.
  • You will also collaborate directly with Nearpod’s Engineering, Marketing, and Data teams to build and execute on the product vision.

About You:

  • You are senior, experienced, and passionate about product management. You have experience at a leadership level growing product organization.
  • You have a passion for education and teaching. You understand the multifaceted jobs that teachers hold today and the challenges inherent to them.
  • You have previously built and scaled a product organization, establishing a culture of excellence for the product team, and extending the production process throughout the company.
  • You leverage behavioral psychology, UX, and data science to deliver customer and business value.
  • You are comfortable understanding and working across both consumer and enterprise client profiles.

Role and Responsibilities:

  • Scale Nearpod’s product vision and strategy and prioritize impactful initiatives that align with our business objectives
  • Lead, mentor, and grow a diverse team including Product Managers, UX designers, and Content/Curriculum Specialists
  • Act as an advocate for a product-centric culture, our mission, and continued innovation and product excellence
  • Establish a data practice across product management measuring to objectives and key results that align with the product and business strategy
  • Identify, prioritize, and evaluate product initiatives and build our product roadmap
  • Drive the implementation of the product roadmap by partnering closely with our engineering, UX, client success, and data teams
  • Work closely with Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success to communicate the product roadmap and ensure new features make it into our customers’ hands.
  • Define, monitor, and analyze product metrics. Communicate important trends and learnings as they happen. Feed learnings back into the product discovery process.
  • Communicate product plans, trade-offs, and results to the company and leadership.

Required Skills and Experience:

  • Previous experience as a senior B2B or B2C2B software product leader, CPO or VP level.
  • High emotional intelligence. Sensitive to the company’s current culture, yet confident enough to establish their own culture based on a strong sense of urgency.
  • Experience in a high-growth, entrepreneurial environment is preferred; with emphasis as a strong strategic thinker having proven to have driven through to implementation.
  • A superb communicator that will be eloquent and charismatic in front of customers, business partners, employees, and investors.
  • Experience hiring, managing, and mentoring high-performing product teams
  • Experience creating, building, and scaling user centric SaaS products
  • Experience with agile & scrum best practices
  • Experience partnering with globally distributed development teams
  • Passion for our product and a growth mindset
  • Experience in Education, specifically K-12 a plus

About Us:

  • Since we launched in 2012, Nearpod has seen wide adoption in the K-12 market; currently, over 100,000 teachers and six million students use Nearpod every month.
  • 2017 marked the second consecutive year that Nearpod has been listed on the Inc.
  • 5000 fastest growing private companies and we have been featured in the Wall Street Journal, Fortune and local news channels across the country.

Nearpod is headquartered in Dania Beach, Florida and is backed by notable investors that include: Insight Venture Partners, Reach Capital, Storm Ventures, the Stanford StartX Fund, the Knight Enterprise Fund, Arsenal Ventures, Marc Benioff (the CEO of Salesforce) and Scott Cook (founder and Chairman of Intuit) and his wife, Signe Ostby

Employment Requirements: Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without restrictions

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply for job

items.title: Content Marketer with Real Estate Experience
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Content Marketer with Real Estate Experience

Company: Brokerkit
Location: remote in the US
Job Type: Freelance
Description

Brokerkit (https://getbrokerkit.com/) is looking for a Content Marketer with real estate experience to assist with developing marketing content for our own marketing and to include in our technology solution for our clients. Brokerkit is a software platform designed for North American residential real estate brokers to recruit, onboard and retain real estate agents.

 

Job Description

 

  • Research for topics that are both interesting and searched for by US-based residential real estate broker/owners
  • Create high-quality long-form blog posts on these topics (including image sourcing and SEO optimizations)
  • The posts will be delivered in our WordPress site with SEO on-page optimization completed
  • Track article metrics over time (search traffic, time on site, etc) in Google Analytics to optimize and improve
  • Assist in developing best practices articles for our clients on topics around recruiting, onboarding and retaining real estate agents
  • Assist in developing email newsletters as well as email campaigns for our use and that of our clients

 

Required Qualifications

  • 3+ years of writing experience in English
  • Top creative and technical writing abilities
  • Perfect English - spelling, and grammar
  • Passion for research
  • Organized and effective and time management skills
  • Team player
  • Degree in English a plus

 

Preferred Qualifications

  • Work experience in residential real estate
  • WordPress experience
  • Understanding of the fundamentals of SEO including keyword research, on-page optimization and backlinking
  • Experience with SEO tools Ahrefs
  • Experience with content analysis tools like Clearscope/Topic
  • Experience with graphic design tools like Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Experience with video editing and production

 

Role

  • This is a part-time freelance position paid $.10 per word.

 

Application Instructions

  • Please complete the form here: https://forms.gle/YE4RcTnE3FZuJAin8

items.title: Medicare agent wanted- free lead generation, remote work, paid 3x per day
items.content:
Join the revolutionary ASSURANCE platform and uncap your earnings on the industry’s best work from home Medicare sales platform, selling Medicare Advantage, Supplement, and Prescription Drug plans to inbound, in-market shoppers.

 

We have just opened up 500 spots nationally for experienced Medicare agents to join our platform by May 29th.Spots are filling up fast! COVID-19 is changing the way all Medicare is sold, but Assurance was built from the ground up as a next-generation solution for times like these.

 

Join the ASSURANCE platform, and take advantage of:

  • 100% remote;, you log in when you’re ready to sell.
  • Assurance pays both commissions and production bonuses. There are no caps on how much you can make, and top ASSURANCE agents earn over $200,000 in compensation annually.
  • Free calls via inbound shoppers generated from ASSURANCE-owned and operated websites, television commercials, and direct mail. Our Guides prospect calls and transfer interested and qualified prospect to you.
  • Access to our proprietary billion-dollar software platform at no cost to you. The platform has all the tools to empower you to succeed!
  • Contract with leading national carriers such as Humana, Aetna, UnitedHealthcare, and more.


You are in total control as you work remotely from the comfort of your home or office. Calls are always flowing on the ASSURANCE platform; when you log in you are put in front of interested consumers ready to talk to you. You’re not spending time prospecting and appointment setting, buying your own leads to dial, or sitting in a call center for 8 hours per day waiting for the phone to ring. You are your ownboss and you’re surrounded online by other top performers just like you.


The Assurance system has eliminated industry inefficiencies and will provide you with free training & scripting, back office accounting & customer service, tech support, recommendation and quoting engines, and custom analytics on your performance. Now you see why we were called “the Uber of insurance” when we were acquired by Prudential Financial (NYSE: PRU) for $3.5B in 2019.

Requirements to access ASSURANCE Medicare platform as 1 of 500 elite producers:

  • AHIP certification
  • 3+ insurance state licenses
  • High-speed Internet, reliable computer, and headset with microphone
  • History of compliant insurance sales practice

items.title: RankScience SEO: SEO/SEM Sales Account Executive
items.content:
SEO/SEM Sales Account Executive

Growth Expert - SEO/SEM Sales

Job Description
We are looking for a highly motivated Sales Executive to bring on new clients through a consultative sales approach. This is a role for a proven sales leader that has strong prospecting and relationship building skills. You will be required to impress potential clients through a detailed analysis of their current SEO/SEM presence and articulate the key value points of RankScience including guarantees and proven results.


RankScience is a YCombinator-backed startup, based in San Francisco, providing SEO and SEM automation services and technology to help businesses around the world grow search traffic. We used advanced tactics like SEO AB Testing and NLP Content Optimization to help customers outrank competitors in Google. We value innovation and collaboration that will continue to provide outstanding results and service to new and existing clients.


Responsibilities:
- Prospecting and follow-ups to nurture relationships and move opportunities through the sales stages.
- Articulate SEO service specifics, value points and results while analyzing current challenges.
- Negotiate contract specifics and pricing.
- Maintain detailed lead and client records within CRM.
- Meet target KPI's monthly and quarterly.
- Collaborate with other departments and provide status updates to management.
- Prospect and close deals
- Take a consultative approach to talking through SEO growth with prospective clients.


Desired Experience & Skills:
- Prior experience in a technical consultative and strategic sales in marketing or interactive media a plus.
- Familiarity with marketing, SEO, SEM or PPC.
- Past experience selling SEO/SEM services or software.
- Excellent relationship building skills and ability to both prospect and close deals.
- Superb interpersonal communication skills, especially where complex technical information must be conveyed.
- Ability to communicate with marketing executives in a polished and profession demeanor.
- Well organized with a knack for time management.
- Motivated and ambitious


Salary will commensurate with experience plus commissions. Top-tier base salary and uncapped earnings with 15-20% commission on all deals closed.


Job Type: Full-time

Additional Compensation:
  • Commission

Work Location:
  • Fully Remote

items.title: BIteable: Social Growth Marketer
items.content:
Social Growth Marketer


All about you

You will be responsible for growing and managing our social channels (FB, IG, LI, YT, and Twitter) along with producing videos for our YouTube channel. If you have relevant experience with influencers, guest posting and/or affiliates, we may tap your talents there as well. 

Role Details 
  • Manage social channels via Meet Edgar (or a different tool of your choosing).
  • Grow social channels and engagement at a determined clip on a quarterly basis. 
    • Create videos for social media, to promote new template releases and
  • Help be the face of Biteable! Create videos and distribute them on YouTube. This is a growing channel for us and a lot of fun to work with.
  • Project manage the delivery of YouTube videos, from topic selection, scriptwriting, and filming, through to liaison with post-production.
  • Communicate frequently throughout the week in Slack and Notion.
  • Have flexible availability (we work with a distributed team)
  • Be available during US business hours.
Role Benefits 
  • Flexible hours: We're not your typical 9-5. While we still expect you to be available throughout the day, we're family friendly and believe in work/life harmony.
  • Limited meetings: We believe in documenting our work and progress in Notion, a team note taking app. That means you're not stuck relaying information in meetings every day of the week.
  • Transparent leadership: We have a flat organization and your direct manager is always available to chat, as is most of the rest of the team, timezones permitting.

All about us 

We are Biteable, a tech start-up that makes (jaw-dropping) videos possible for everyone. We stand apart in our market thanks to our dedication to studio-quality content and our passion for simplicity. 

Since our launch in 2014 we’ve: 
  • Created a community of over 7 million users
  • Rendered more than 10 million videos
  • Raised $3.9 million in venture capital
We’re growing fast and have offices in Melbourne and Hobart, Australia, with remote team members scattered around the world. We are informal, structurally flat, and fun to work with. 

All about our culture 

We are committed to the happiness of our team. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We like it when everyone feels supported and free to create. 

Our team members genuinely care about each other and define themselves as rigorous, respectful, open, supportive, honest, and egoless. Here are a few quotes that we didn’t make up: 

“I’m thankful for the flexibility Biteable gives me around my family commitments. I really like that my team is open to new ideas and processes. And I enjoy that I get to work on a variety of problems with a mix of people with diverse areas of expertise.” 

“The development team is a great group of people. They’re smart and interested in doing high-quality work, but foster a social and supportive atmosphere, too.” 

“Biteable's team of smart, funny, engaged and caring people makes my work here enjoyable, every day. Being close to decisions and decision-makers helps me make an impact on our work.”

items.title: Campaign Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Wonderbly is a unique, award winning start-up that lives on the intersection of storytelling, engineering, digital and print. We are building a global personal-publishing business that brings millions of people into our products - as co-creators and audiences.


With over 5 million products sold in over 150 countries we are the world's leading personalised books company. We create uncompromisingly high-quality personalised books to inspire courage, curiosity and kindness in children all over the world. We truly believe that imaginatively personalised stories are one of the greatest ways to make a child feel loved, unique and capable of anything. To show them that any story they imagine could be their story.


The role


We are looking for a brilliant Campaign Manager to join the team. This is a newly created pivotal role that sits on the intersection of our product, comms design and marketing teams.


Creative and organised in equal measures, this is a mid level role suitable for someone who has existing experience managing effective marketing plans and campaigns. The role will fit a Planner or Account Manager (if you come from agency side), or a seasoned Campaign Executive looking for a step up where they can have more responsibility. Wherever you’re coming from, you’ve worked closely with creative teams or agencies (and if we’ll ask they will say you’re a fantastic communicator and incredible team player).


Above all we are looking for someone who is great with people, highly organised and can juggle multiple campaigns at any one time. You love data with your morning coffee and thrive in a creative environment. In addition, if you are clearly passionate about books and children’s media that would also be a bonus.





Requirements



As an impeccably organised individual with a creative heart, you’ll be managing the delivery of campaign assets, and ultimately ensuring that creative execution and media all work in perfect harmony. Here are some of the things you’ll enjoy doing:



  • Write inspiring marketing communication briefs for marketing events and product launches

  • Work with the creative team to develop the single minded message and secondary messages for every brief

  • Work with the channel owners to identify key audiences and reasons to believe, and also to ensure all channel requirements are detailed within each brief

  • Challenge channel and site content owners to think innovatively from a customer perspective, and holistically for briefs where relevant

  • Become the central coordinating figure between the channel marketing team and the creative marketing team

  • Ensure all marketing campaigns are integrated across channels and different countries

  • Provide direction for the creative marketing team on the prioritisation of briefs.

  • Ensure assets are delivered and campaigns are launched on time and on brief





Benefits



First and foremost you should join Wonderbly because of the work. We’re on a mission to inspire boundless self belief in every child, everywhere through our beautiful personalised books. We’ve sold a few million books so far and we want to sell hundreds of millions more!



  • This is a permanent role with a salary of £35,000 to £40,000

  • Working at Wonderbly you’ll be surrounded by positive, self motivated people inspired by this exciting mission. You’ll also get to work from our fun, light filled, colourful studio building in East London

  • We offer a range of additional benefits beyond the work that will make your time at Wonderbly even more fun:

  • We offer free team Yoga classes; just one of the many ways we keep centred and calm, despite the (occasional) chaos of startup life

  • Health insurance and our cycle to work scheme will keep you and your family in tip-top shape

  • We have showers, secure bike parking facilities and are part of the Cycle To Work scheme

  • We have heaps of snacks, drinks, and comforts in our fully-stocked kitchen

  • Speaking of food; team lunches and breakfasts. We nearly forgot team lunches. Once a week we get together over a delicious free team lunch and spend some tasty quality time together.

items.title: The JW Agency: Facebook Ad Manager
items.content:
Facebook Ad Manager

HIRING A ROCKSTAR FACEBOOK AD MANAGER

The JW Agency is a FAST growing digital marketing agency and we are in need of another ROCKSTAR Facebook Ad Manager to join the team.

We partner with entrepreneurs to generate consistent leads and sales while rapidly scaling their revenue using innovative and cutting edge marketing strategies through paid Facebook advertising.  We specifically work with business owners selling digital products, coaching programs, high-ticket offers and ecommerce products.

The Facebook Ad Manager works daily on client ad accounts to implement, optimize and monitor Facebook advertising campaigns, ensure KPI’s are being met, provide reports and trends to clients, and continuously be innovative and strategic with client campaigns to maximize results.

You'll be part of a team that loves to collaborate, share ideas, share funny memes, and provide support to one another on a daily basis.

This position is:
~ 100% Remote
~ Full-time, 40+ Hour Contract Position
~ Available 9am-5pm (North American Time Zones)

Responsibilities (Tasks Associated with the Role)
  • Develop, manage and optimize comprehensive paid Facebook Ad campaigns
  • Understanding funnels and digital marketing strategies for all client campaigns and following the JW Agency process
  • Audience research, audience building and ad creation
  • Audit and optimize new & existing ad campaigns to ensure KPI’s are met such as budget spend, timelines, CPL, CPA, ROI, and ROAS - both short and long term.
  • Identify new opportunities to increase client conversions regularly
  • Update clients via weekly emails, calls, and reports on current status of account, successes and strategy moving forward. Respond to all communications in a timely manner
  • Participate in all team meetings - daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly

Reporting
  • Manage social performance reporting process, communicating results with Marketing Manager in the agency as needed and on a daily, weekly or monthly basis.
  • Organize hypotheses and recommendations, and be comfortable sharing with internal Project members
  • Communicate consistently and professionally with Marketing Manager

Tracking
  • Setup, verify and troubleshoot pixels (understanding of 3rd party platforms like Clickfunnels, Leadpages, Ontraport, etc. are helpful)
  • Understanding of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager is a plus

Results (Expected Accomplishments)
  • Maintain a positive ROI and hit all KPI’s for client accounts.
  • Learn, understand and implement the JW Agency ad launch process to ensure proper execution of job responsibilities, management of client accounts, and ongoing optimization.
  • Confidently provide client support with very little oversight from management.
  • Be available when necessary for agency client campaign support.
  • All tasks are completed on time, correctly, and with little support.
  • Communication with team members is clear and effective, along with professional and concise. 

Requirements (Expected Proficiencies)
  • 2+ years experience and knowledge of online funnel marketing strategies 
  • Minimum 2 years Facebook Ads mastery 
  • Knowledge of testing practices
  • Very organized and loves utilizing project management tools
  • Ability to have a big picture view while executing and managing details 
  • A die-hard commitment to achieving results 
  • Excellent analytical skills with ability to mine data to inform decisions 
  • You prefer working with a fast-driven agency, where we’re always testing, and data is king 
  • Must be flexible with weekly schedule, adaptable, and willing to take on multiple priorities
  • Excellent organization and time management skills to complete tasks on time.
  • Ability to speak with clients in a calm and clear way via phone, email, zoom or other 3rd party tools.
  • Knowledge of landing page or CRM platforms such as Clickfunnels, Leadpages, Aweber, Mailchimp, Convertkit, etc.
  • Collaborate with other teams, like marketing, sales and customer service to ensure brand consistency
  • Stay up-to-date with current technologies and trends in Facebook policies, strategies, trends, design tools and applications
  • Ready and willing to dedicate time to an amazing team with amazing clients
  • Preferred: Experience running targeted, high-spend, high-return ad campaigns, specifically on Facebook 
  • Available 9am-5pm (North American Time Zones)
  • Full-time 40+ hours a week Contractor position

Only apply here: https://live.jessicawalman.com/fbadmanager

items.title: AgentFire.com: Content Marketing Manager (with Real Estate Experience!)
items.content:
Content Marketing Manager (with Real Estate Experience!)

Who we are:
AgentFire is the #1 rated real estate website platform - powering agents, teams and brokerages across North America and Canada with our hugely popular ‘Spark Sites!’

As the Senior Content Marketing Manager, you’ll be responsible for helping us to manage and optimize ALL of our content marketing efforts (which consist of Content, Email, and Social Media Marketing) into one cohesive, well-oiled machine. 

How we work:
AgentFire’s team consists of roughly 40 remote individuals - Slack is what we use for team communication, and Asana is what we use to manage projects. 

We’re an extremely tight-knit team with a GREAT product that’s seen huge growth over the last few years. 

Our perfect hire:
If you’re looking for a remote role where you will be EMPOWERED in every way possible to succeed - you enjoy coordinating between multiple projects with tactical precision - you’ve got a lot of relevant real estate industry experience - and you want to grow in a manner consistent with the results you’re able to produce, look no further!

Here are the specific skills & responsibilities that we’re looking for

Content Marketing
  • Plan our overarching blog article strategy & manage our team of 3 writers
  • Identify best opportunities for high-ranking content via Ahrefs (by looking at trends, competitors, and our own content)
  • Build our outbound strategy (guest posts & links) - We’ll likely need to hire someone here full-time that you will manage. 
Email Marketing
  • Create, schedule & manage weekly newsletter updates
  • Create drip email campaigns via AutopilotHQ
  • Coordinate with our product, marketing, and sales team to schedule email releases, promotions, and marketing emails
Social Media
  • Manage social media accounts i.e. schedule & promote new content, promos and articles on social channels (Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram) using Hootsuite
  • Coordinate creating graphic assets with our graphic designer 
  • Community management (engage and post new product releases & relevant content to our Facebook groups)
To Apply:
Please record a short video (60 - 90 seconds) answering the following questions:
  1. How would you rate your experience (1-10) producing results from organic & outbound marketing? 
  2. What’s the biggest success you’ve had in your marketing career?
  3. How would you rate your ability to write copy? (1-10)
  4. We listed a number of platforms above (Slack, Asana, AutopilotHQ, Hootsuite, Ahrefs) - any experience with them or with similar platforms? 
  5. What are you most excited about regarding our position? 
Please send the video to hiring@agentfire.com with the subject line:
Senior Content Marketing Manager
...and since that’s a rather boring subject line, feel free to also include emoji’s

We’re looking to hire ASAP and will pull this job post down as soon as we’ve found our person. Thanks and looking forward to hearing from you!

items.title: Senior Product and Digital Marketer, B2B
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Remote

Permanent employee, Full-time · Remote

ABOUT US

quintly is a web-based solution that empowers brands, agencies, and media companies to use social media successfully by providing analytical solutions. With a strong international footprint, quintly currently consists of a multicultural team and serves customers in over 50 countries.

WE ARE LOOKING FOR…

We are looking to add a Senior Product & Digital Marketer to our small and hands-on team! Your main responsibility will be to take full ownership of our marketing initiatives with a strong focus on product marketing. If you consider yourself an expert B2B marketer with a tech background, come and join us!

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Take full ownership of our marketing strategy with focus on product communication
  • Execute initiatives with a hands-on mentality
  • Turn new feature releases into meaningful marketing launch communication in alignment with the product team
  • Work closely with the customer success team in order to identify opportunities of communicating our product
  • Demand generation and driving acquisition strategy, identifying the channels and activities needed to deliver against agreed targets (MQLs)
  • Manage the CRM (Hubspot) from a marketing point of view and setup the measurement framework to see how we are doing against our goals
  • Partner with the sales team to ensure efficient lead hand-over and optimize lead quality

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • 5+ years relevant experience in B2B product marketing, preferably SaaS
  • BA/BS degree in business, technical or other field
  • Experience with B2B customers across paid and unpaid growth channels
  • Experience with CRM / marketing automation (preferably Hubspot)
  • Advanced knowledge of at least one programming language (e.g., Javascript, PHP)
  • Hands-on / can-do mentality
  • Proactive nature and independent working style
  • Strong analytical mind, data-savvy thinking is a must
  • Highly proficient in spoken and written English

YOUR BENEFITS

  • Remote working environment
  • Flat hierarchies, self responsible and independent working mode
  • Individual education budget for professional and personal development
  • Modern working environment with fresh fruit, coffee and newest hardware
  • Become part of a multi­cultural team
Apply for job

items.title: Technical Product Manager, Platform Services
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
Remote

Remote or Boston, MA

Overview

With over 10,000 online merchants launching subscriptions and over 1,000,000 subscribers powered by ReCharge, we have a lot of store owners to support. Our mission to make repeat orders easier began five years ago as a bootstrapped startup and today we’re at the forefront of recurring billing software with over 175 remote-first employees around the globe processing hundreds of millions of dollars in sales every month.

Our SaaS platform is used by millions of people every month and our Platform Services team is looking for a Product Manager to collaborate on a critical part of the platform. This team builds business critical platforms and services that allow ReCharge to run applications reliably at scale, providing ReCharge with forward-looking tech stack components that take advantage of the cloud (tech stack 2.0). We’re looking for a teammate who is resourceful, dedicated, and passionate about solving challenging problems. This role is for someone who loves diving into the technical details while also driving the overall strategy. We need a creative and resourceful integrator who will actively listen for problems and then accelerate the team towards solving.

Our stack includes: Python, Flask, JavaScript, Vue.js

What You’ll Do

  • Live by and champion our values: #ownership, #empathy, #simple-solutions.
  • Product Manager for a platform team consisting of 4-6 engineers.
  • Write epics and detailed user stories for the engineering, QA, and design teams to fully understand the scope of functionality and business drivers, so they can estimate and deliver in a timely manner with high quality.
  • Facilitate and work in a kanban (agile) environment with daily stand-ups, weekly grooming and planning sessions.
  • Prioritize features and define requirements for successful delivery.
  • Dig into details and figure things out from detailed business logic to a high level technical perspective.
  • Turn high level ideas and requirements into technical specifications.
  • Effectively communicate and collaborate with all groups in the organization over the entire product development lifecycle­ from requirements gathering to release to rollout training.
  • We’re an agile, fast growing company and you’ll get to do much more as the company grows.

What You’ll Bring

  • Typically, 5+ years of product management experience in a fast paced technology driven company (preferably SaaS)
  • Track record of launching products rapidly on a SaaS platform with a large number of customers
  • 3+ years experience working directly with software engineering teams to build product
  • Experience owning and delivering high-impact software products
  • Ability to work autonomously with a balanced team approach, you don’t need to wait for directions, but know when buy-in is critical
  • Some light programming experience or general technical aptitude
  • Ability to read if/else statements, JSON, and basic API documentation
  • Dynamic problem solving skills and a love for figuring out solutions
  • An entrepreneurial spirit and excited to work on complex problems at scale
  • Ability to work remotely and desire to make an impact in a highly visible role
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

ReCharge Payments is an equal opportunity employer. In addition to EEO being the law, it is a policy that is fully consistent with our principles. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy or age. ReCharge Payments prohibits any form of workplace harassment.

Apply for job

items.content:
Process Street

Senior Product Manager

 Who We Are Process Street is the easy, no-code way to help companies build, automate, and track recurring workflows. We are a lean, flexible, 100% distributed team, backed by amazing investors like Accel, Salesforce, and Atlassian.  All 40-plus of us work wherever we’d like—reliable internet access is our only requirement. Spread across 9 time zones in 10 countries, we sign into Slack and open up our work tools on the schedule that fits our lives best. We communicate asynchronously, work autonomously, and take ownership of our work. Distributed work isn’t for everyone, but if it fits your management style, it’s a life-changing benefit. Being 100% distributed doesn’t stop us from getting to know each other— we have daily conversations in chat, weekly “coffee” pairings with coworkers, and once a year we all come together for an all-team retreat. What Makes Us Different * Fully remote team - no offices * Unlimited PTO policy * Annual company offsite * Generous health insurance for US Employees and their families Our values  As a small, nimble company, we want our employees to feel empowered to make decisions and define the future of our company, so our values include: * Act like an owner (Agency!) * Default to action (Processes are great; bureaucracy isn't!) * Focus on the process (See? Great.) * Practice prioritization (There are an infinite number of useful things to do. We trust you to pick the best ones.) * Pay attention to details (Our customers count on us!) * Over-communicate everything. Twice (See what we did there?) The Opportunity  We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to help us make recurring work fun, fast, and faultless for teams everywhere. What You’ll Do  * You’ll be responsible for defining a product strategy and KPIs, gaining alignment from company leaders and stakeholders, and prioritizing a roadmap that helps your team achieve your business goals. * You will articulate user problems and product needs, iterating with a core team of design and engineering experts as well as stakeholders in research, data, support, sales, and marketing and other company stakeholders. * You’ll help define hypotheses for product enhancements and run experiments to validate contributions towards user and business outcomes. * You will coordinate across teams to maintain product and strategy alignment, eliminating surprises, and finding creative ways to make the “whole greater than the sum of its parts.” About You * 5+ years as a Product Manager at a product-led SaaS software company * Familiarity with design and development team workflows * A data-driven approach to product development and growth * Comfortable engaging with end-users, conducting user research, and intelligently integrating findings into your work * The ability to dive into big projects and manage them from start to finish * The ability to thrive in a variable and demanding startup environment Diverse Teams Build Better Products Legally, we need you to know this:  Process Street does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class. We support workplace diversity. But we want to add this: We strongly believe that diversity contributes to a broader collective perspective that will consistently lead to a better company and better products. We are working hard to increase the diversity of our team wherever we can and we actively encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of it.

items.title: Best Remote Working Opportunity. Inbound leads. Sell well-known carriers
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Join the revolutionary ASSURANCE platform and uncap your earnings on the industry’s best work from home Medicare sales platform, selling Medicare Advantage, Supplement, and Prescription Drug plans to inbound, in-market shoppers.

 

We have just opened up 500 spots nationally for experienced Medicare agents to join our platform by May 29th.Spots are filling up fast! COVID-19 is changing the way all Medicare is sold, but Assurance was built from the ground up as a next-generation solution for times like these.

 

Join the ASSURANCE platform, and take advantage of:

  • 100% remote;, you log in when you’re ready to sell.
  • Assurance pays both commissions and production bonuses. There are no caps on how much you can make, and top ASSURANCE agents earn over $200,000 in compensation annually.
  • Free calls via inbound shoppers generated from ASSURANCE-owned and operated websites, television commercials, and direct mail. Our Guides prospect calls and transfer interested and qualified prospect to you.
  • Access to our proprietary billion-dollar software platform at no cost to you. The platform has all the tools to empower you to succeed!
  • Contract with leading national carriers such as Humana, Aetna, UnitedHealthcare, and more.


You are in total control as you work remotely from the comfort of your home or office. Calls are always flowing on the ASSURANCE platform; when you log in you are put in front of interested consumers ready to talk to you. You’re not spending time prospecting and appointment setting, buying your own leads to dial, or sitting in a call center for 8 hours per day waiting for the phone to ring. You are your ownboss and you’re surrounded online by other top performers just like you.


The Assurance system has eliminated industry inefficiencies and will provide you with free training & scripting, back office accounting & customer service, tech support, recommendation and quoting engines, and custom analytics on your performance. Now you see why we were called “the Uber of insurance” when we were acquired by Prudential Financial (NYSE: PRU) for $3.5B in 2019.

Requirements to access ASSURANCE Medicare platform as 1 of 500 elite producers:

  • AHIP certification
  • 3+ insurance state licenses
  • High-speed Internet, reliable computer, and headset with microphone
  • History of compliant insurance sales practice
